SUBREG(2)
You are the youngest son born to me and my husband Kancharla Balanagara.
I am currently living with you in my old age. You are taking good care of my food and drink. Therefore, in return for my love for you, I and Kancharla Balanagayya garu's son Venkatachennayya garu together sold the land on 24-01-2008 through Mahbub garu, wife of Sheikh Chinna Khader garu, village head of Yerragondapalem village and registered it in the Yerragondapalem office as sale deed no. 120/2008. Later, my joint right holder Kancharla Balanagayya garu's son Venkatachennayya garu registered the release deed no. 2407/2010 in the Yerragondapalem Sub-Registrar's office on 09-08-2010 in my name, and I also have the right to the remaining half of the land. I have transferred to you this day, free of charge, the property listed in the Schedule below, valued at Rs. 4,83,000/- in characters, free of charge. From now on, you shall be the owner of the property listed in the Schedule and shall enjoy it with full rights of donation and sale, as you wish, throughout your descendants. Neither I nor my heirs nor you nor your heirs shall have any objections or disputes in this regard. If anyone has made any objections to the property listed in the Schedule in the past, I will act at my own expense and confirm this sale deed. I have not made any encroachments on the property as per the Scheduled Property Act, Government Institutions or any other person. The property as per the Scheduled Property Act was not acquired by the Government under their 9/77 Act. In order to remove my name from the Panchayat accounts and include your name, the following notice forms are enclosed herewith. This is a document of immovable property registered with my consent. Kancharla Yogamma A.Bo. Mark 921/2019

Rupees have been paid to me in the presence of the following witnesses. I hereby give up my right to do so. Therefore, from now on, you shall be the full owner of the property as per the schedule and shall enjoy it with full rights of donation and sale for the benefit of your children and grandchildren. I, my heirs, you, your heirs, and I will never have any dispute or dispute with you or your heirs regarding the property as per Schedule. If any other person or entity makes any objection to you regarding the property as per Schedule, I will be able to confirm this document to you at my own expense. The property as per Schedule is not an assignment title obtained by the Government under their 9/77 Act. The Government has not made any alienation to them or to others regarding the property as per Schedule. This is a written release of the right to immovable property given with my consent. The property shall be enjoyed happily till the time of the birth. Neither I nor my heirs nor you nor your heirs shall be able to make any kind of dispute or dispute regarding the property as per the schedule.
Moreover, if any other person has made any claim regarding the schedule, I am the only one who can give you this sale deed after having paid my own expenses. The property listed in the Schedules was not acquired by the Government under Section 9/77 and the Government has not transferred the property listed in the Schedules to them or to any other person. I have removed my name from the revenue records and added your names and have enclosed the transfer forms herewith. This is a sale deed written by me with all my heart and soul. There are no other documents in the Sheds, houses or other properties. As such, the previous petitions have been filed. The magistrates are I am not worried
I will pay the price of the world and I will give it. This is consent.

Gift Settlement in f/o family
Mkt.Value:Rs. 446760

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 921 of 2019, dated 15/Apr/2019, executed by Kancharla Yogamma, in favour of her Son, Kancharla Madhu Goud, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 48 Sq. Yds, (or) 432 Sq. Ft., bearing house number 2-302, comprised in survey number 580, situated in Yerragondapalem Revenue Village and Grama Panchayathi, Yerragondapalem Mandal, Erstwhile Prakasam Now, within the District of Markapuram, registered at sub-registrar office Yerragondapalem, is bounded as follows: North by: Building of Shaik Ameer South by: Road East by: Road West by: Building of Pamula Ramanamma

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 580, Located Nearby house no.2-302, situated in Yerragondapalem Village, measuring about 48 Sq. Yds. (or) 432 Sq. Ft., was originally owned by Shaik Mahaboob Bi.[Ref:Deed] 2. The aforementioned Shaik Mahaboob Bi executed a Sale Deed on 24-Jan-2008, registered as document No. 120 of 2008, before the SRO Yerragondapalem in favour of Kancherla Yegamma, Kancherla Venkata Channaiah, towards the property measuring 48 Sq. Yds. (or) 432 Sq. Ft.,, Located Nearby house no.2-302, situated in Yerragondapalem Village 3. The aforementioned Kancherla Venkata Channaiah executed a Relinquishment Deed on 09-Aug-2010, registered as document No. 2407 of 2010, before the SRO Yerragondapalem, in favour of Kancherla Yegamma, towards the property measuring 24 Sq. Yds. (or) 216Sq. Ft., Located Nearby house no.2-302, situated in Yerragondapalem Village Note: It is noted that Kancherla Yegamma, is already a holder of 1/2 share over the property and by virtue of this deed he/she became the absolute owner of the property of total 48 Sq. Yds. 4. The aforementioned Kancherla Yegamma, executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 15/Apr/2019, registered as document No. 921 of 2019, before the SRO Yerragondapalem in favour of her Son, Kancharla Madhu Goud towards the property measuring 48Sq. Yds. (or) 432 Sq. Ft., Located Nearby house no.2-302, situated in Yerragondapalem Village. Note:It is to be noted that there is spell error with the Executant name between Deed it is mentioned as Kancherla Yegamma, and EC, it is mentioned as Kancherla Yogamma it is, therefore advisable for F.I. to obtain rectified EC as per Deed. 5. The aforementioned Kancharla Madhu Goud, executed a Mortgage Deed on 30-Jan-2023, registered as document No. 339 of 2023, before the SRO Yerragondapalem in favour of Nagaraju Palankaiah, towards the property measuring 48 Sq. Yds. (or) 432 Sq. Ft., situated in Yerragondapalem Village, which was subsequently discharged vide Receipt Deed dated 25/Nov/2024, registered as document no.8225 of 2024.[Ref:EC] 6. . The aforementioned Kancharla Madhu Goud, executed a Mortgage Deed on 27-Nov-2024, registered as document No. 8251 of 2024, before the SRO Yerragondapalem in favour of Jupalli Ramanjaneyulu, towards the property measuring 48 Sq. Yds. (or) 432 Sq. Ft., situated in Yerragondapalem Village. [Ref:EC] Note:: It is to be noted that there is an active mortgage vide Doc.No.8251 of 2024, with Jupalli Ramanjaneyulu, whereas, it is informed by F.I. that they reverted back to give conditional report, hence, F.I. is to obtain a Receipt Deed before the disbursement of the loan. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : The Property Tax Receipt No.563, dated 11/Sep/2025, imprinted by the Yerragondapalem Panchayath Secretary discloses that Kancharla Madhu Goud has paid property tax for the period 2020-2025 towards Assessment number 1347. Note: It is advisable to verify that the tax is paid up-to-date towards the schedule property.
The HTR proceedings were concluded in the name of the current owner, Kancharla Madhu Goud.

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Kancharla Madhu Goud, possesses a clear, valid, title to the property measuring 48 Sq. Yds., (or) 432Sq. Ft.,  bearing house number 2-302, omprised in survey number 580, situated in Yerragondapalem Revenue Village and Grama Panchayathi, Yerragondapalem Mandal, Erstwhile Prakasam Now, within the District of Markapuram, registered at subregistrar office Yerragondapalem. Subject to discharge of Active Mortagage Vide Doc. No. 8251 of 2024.

Further, the current owner, Kancharla Madhu Goud, is to be added as a party to the loan structure along with the applicant Kancharla Aruna.

Note:It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
